intro: Marattia fraxinea var. salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf fern, is a variant of the fraxinea fern species. It is a perennial plant belonging to the family Blechnaceae, characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. The leaves are typically lanceolate or willow-like in shape, with a soft, pale green coloration. This fern thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in temperate forests. Its botanical features make it a desirable ornamental plant for shaded garden settings.
